content: उन्नम् {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> {@--1@} ({%a%}) To rise, appear; उन्नम्योन्नम्य लीयंते दरिद्राणां मनोरथाः <ls>Pt. 2. 91.</ls> ({%b%}) To hang over, arise, impend; उन्नमत्यकालदुर्दिनम् <ls>Mk. 4</ls>, <ls n="Mk.">5</ls> an untimely storm impends; बहलोन्नमदंबुधराः <ls>Māl. 9. 18.</ls> ({%c%}) To rise, ascend, go up (<ab>fig.</ab> also); उन्नमति नमति वर्षति गर्जति मेघः <ls>Mk. 5</ls>; नम्रत्वेनोन्नमंतः <ls>Bh. 2. 69.</ls> {@--2@} To bend up, raise, elevate, erect; <ls>Ki. 16. 35.</ls> {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} (नमयति) {@--1@} To bend upwards, raise, erect; मुखमुन्नमय्य <ls>Ku. 7. 23</ls>; <ls>Ś. 3. 25</ls>; <ls>R. 1. 41.</ls> {@--2@} (<ab>fig.</ab>) To elevate, raise to eminence; उन्नमय बंधुवर्गं <ls>K. 109.</ls>
